entry.title: The Optimist Club of Roseburg highlights haunted history with Ghosts of Roseburg Tour
entry.summary: Roseburg is a town steeped in history. Since its founding in 1851, the city has persisted through era after era of American history, from the pioneer days to the prohibition to the infamous Roseburg Blast.

entry.title: U.S. Bank to Close Drain Branch in January 2026
entry.summary: U.S. Bank will close its Drain branch on January 15, 2026. Officials say the move reflects a shift toward digital banking, with no disruption to customer accounts. The nearest branch will be in Cottage Grove. U.S. Bank also plans to close its Mill City branch days earlier on January 12.

entry.title: Roseburg School Board Prioritizes Funding for Locker Room Privacy Upgrades
entry.summary: The Roseburg School Board has approved up to $95,000 to add private changing and shower areas to Roseburg High School’s locker rooms. The upgrades aim to improve student comfort and privacy, with plans for individual stalls and enclosed spaces funded through the district’s 404 infrastructure fund.

entry.title: Goin’ Postal Hobbies & More Opens New Roseburg Location
entry.summary: Goin’ Postal has opened a new Roseburg location at 2210 Stewart Parkway, now called Goin’ Postal Hobbies & More. The store combines shipping services with toys, collectibles, and games at bargain prices. A grand opening sale offers $139.99 mailboxes through the end of the month.

entry.title: New Holiday Inn Express Nearing Completion in Roseburg
entry.summary: A new Holiday Inn Express on Northwest Mulholland Drive in Roseburg is nearly complete. The 100-room hotel, featuring an indoor pool, is expected to open in January as part of the Hanna Heritage Place development, expanding Roseburg’s hospitality and retail offerings.

entry.title: Roseburg school board passes motion to pursue private accommodations for locker rooms
entry.summary: It's an experience many are familiar with: filing into a locker room after P.E. class and changing into casual clothes in front of your classmates. But does this have to be the future for students in Roseburg schools?

entry.title: Roseburg Police to Host National Drug Take Back Day on October 24
entry.summary: The Roseburg Police Department will host National Drug Take Back Day on Friday, Oct. 24, 2025, from 8 a.m.–12 p.m. and 1–5 p.m. at 700 SE Douglas Ave. Residents can safely and anonymously dispose of unwanted or expired medications. Illicit substances will not be accepted.

entry.title: Lookingglass Fire District Secures Cardiac Monitor Through Community Donations
entry.summary: Lookingglass Rural Fire District has purchased its first-ever cardiac monitor thanks to $22,500 in community donations from the Cow Creek Band of Umpqua Tribe of Indians and the Ford Family Foundation. The new equipment will improve local emergency response and cardiac care.

entry.title: Roseburg homeowners get free leaf pickup, mulch in November

entry.title: Fire claims Fisher Road home on outskirts of Roseburg
entry.summary: Jim Barnes was laying in bed, earplugs in and sound asleep, when his house caught fire. Unable to hear the blaze as it spread, he only woke after a passer-by began to bang on his front door.
